intro: Festuca rubra var. denudata, commonly known as the red fescue, is a cool-season grass native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its fine, dark green leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. This variety is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in poor soils. It is often used in turfgrass and landscaping due to its hardiness and aesthetic appeal. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade.
